answered.answer: Cross-phase reuse first, then cross-agent sharing, then size minimization
answered.question: What is the priority order for cache optimization?

answered.answer: Hybrid 2-tier: Tier 1 shared across all agents (tools, project meta), Tier 2 shared within role families (planning vs execution), Tier 3 role-specific volatile tail
answered.question: How should the prefix be structured for cross-agent sharing?

answered.answer: Moderate pruning to ~40 lines. Move verbose sections (isolation, conventions) to skills. Keep critical rules
answered.question: How aggressively should CLAUDE.md be pruned?

answered.answer: No — current role-based filtering is sufficient. Task-level scoping adds complexity for marginal gains
answered.question: Should codebase mapping injection be task-scoped?

answered.answer: Unknown — need measurement first. Telemetry (v3_metrics, v3_event_log) exists but hasn't been analyzed
answered.question: Where is the biggest token waste?

answered.answer: Comprehensive dashboard: per-agent cost breakdown with cache hit rates, waste identification, and ROI per phase
answered.question: What metrics should be surfaced?

answered.answer: All: skills system, hooks for automation, subagent architecture — systematic audit and optimization
answered.question: Which Claude Code features should YOLO leverage more?

answered.answer: Selective — convert only the largest/least-used references. Keep frequently-used ones (brand essentials, effort profiles) always-loaded
answered.question: Should protocol references become skills?

answered.answer: Use toml_edit crate for proper TOML parsing/writing. Preserves formatting and comments.
answered.question: How should bump_version.rs update Cargo.toml (TOML format)?

answered.answer: Always in sync. One product, one version. All 4 files match VERSION as SSOT.
answered.question: Should Cargo.toml version always match plugin VERSION file?

answered.answer: Delete .claude-plugin/marketplace.json. Root marketplace.json is canonical for marketplace discovery. .claude-plugin/ keeps only plugin.json.
answered.question: How to consolidate two identical marketplace.json files?

answered.answer: Extend yolo bump-version CLI with --major/--minor flags. Archive delegates all version logic to CLI. Remove bash version math from archive.md.
answered.question: How to handle archive.md duplicate version bump logic?

answered.answer: Force sync immediately. bump_version.rs always reads VERSION as SSOT and writes to all targets regardless of starting state.
answered.question: How to handle initial Cargo.toml version drift (2.7.1 vs 2.9.5)?

answered.answer: All 5: qa-suite, resolve-agent, release-suite, resolve-models-all, bootstrap-all
answered.question: Which facade commands should we build?

answered.answer: Run all 5 checks in parallel, return unified JSON with per-check results + overall pass/fail. Individual commands coexist for debugging.
answered.question: How should qa-suite aggregate the 5 QA checks?

answered.answer: Full preview with no side effects. Compute version, show changelog edit, list files, show commit message + tag — write nothing.
answered.question: What should --dry-run show for release-suite?

answered.answer: Report and stop. No automatic rollback. User decides whether to retry, reset, or fix.
answered.question: How should release-suite handle partial failure?

answered.answer: Yes, auto-include Cargo.toml and Cargo.lock (if changed) in release commit git add.
answered.question: Should release-suite include Cargo.toml in the release commit?

answered.answer: Merge into single resolve-agent command with --all flag. Single agent returns {model, turns}. --all returns all agents. Always return complete data with defaults — caller never needs fallback logic.
answered.question: How should resolve-agent and resolve-models-all be structured?

answered.answer: Facade-first, remove old sequential patterns from all instruction files. Clean break.
answered.question: How should instructions be updated to use facades?

deferred.idea: CI job for Rust build/test (currently only lint + bats)

inferred.text: VERSION file is SSOT. bump-version updates VERSION, plugin.json, marketplace.json, and Cargo.toml.
Archive creates GitHub release with gh release create after tag+push.
4 facade commands batch sequential operations: qa-suite, resolve-agent (with --all), release-suite, bootstrap-all. resolve-models-all merged into resolve-agent --all.
Consolidate to single marketplace.json at repo root. Remove .claude-plugin/marketplace.json.

key_findings: Plugin manifest (.claude-plugin/plugin.json) is required for MCP server config
toml_edit crate preserves TOML formatting on edit
gh release create supports --notes-file for changelog sections
bump_version.rs manages 4 JSON files but missing Cargo.toml (TOML)
Cargo.toml version drifted to 2.7.1 while plugin is at 2.9.5
QA suite: 5 commands called sequentially in execute-protocol (SKILL.md:800-846)
resolve-agent: 2 calls per agent (resolve-model + resolve-turns) x5 agents in execute-protocol
release-suite: 6-step sequence in archive.md (bump, changelog, stage, commit, tag, push)
bootstrap-all: 6-7 sequential bootstrap calls in bootstrap.md
Router has 80+ flat commands, no existing composite patterns
